caption:
The photograph depicts an outdoor scene where two women are engaged in a transaction. The woman on the left, partially cropped from the frame, is seated behind a ticket booth or small service window, while the woman on the right, who is standing, appears to be either making a payment or receiving a ticket. The standing woman is looking down, likely focusing on her wallet, which she holds open in her hands.

The ticket booth, painted in a deep orange or red, is under a large awning striped in a dark blue and bold red. In the blurred background, a bustling street scene unfolds with various people milling about, which suggests a public, possibly urban environment. The people in the background appear casually dressed, in line with what might be expected of a day out in a city.

The atmosphere seems informal and everyday, with a sense of vibrant activity implicit in the background. The focus and interaction between the two women, along with the prominent placement of the ticket booth in the frame, suggest a theme of day-to-day commerce or transactions in a lively public space.
title: Munich's large and beautiful Fussgangerzone (pedestrian zone) has returned the city's commercial and cultural center to the people. It is totally traffic free. Not even bicycle riding is permitted. The city controls licensing of concessions and mid-street display stands in the pedestrian zone.
